chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ray M Poeppel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1).
  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-In Public, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Ray M Poeppel in court with attorney John T. Stichert.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lambert makes statement regarding second preliminary hearing.  Attorney Stichert makes objection to procedure. Court proceeds with preliminary hearing. 
Attorney Lambert calls Sara McCormick as witness.  Witness sworn in and testifies.  Witness identifies defendant in the courtroom.  
Cross examination by Attorney Stichert. Exhibit 1 - Employment records from business.  Exhibit 2 - Copy of transcript. 
Redirect by Attorney Lambert. 
Argument made by Attorney Lambert.  Motions court to amend criminal complaint.  
Court finds probable cause. Attorney Stichert motions to schedule arraignment at a later date.  Bond continued.

of Craig Lambert - Amended
for Adjournment of Jury Trial

3:34 Defendant Ray M Poeppel by phone with attorney John T. Stichert.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State has filed a motion to amend Information and to adjourn. Attorney Stichert is not objecting to adjournment. State has not complied with victim's rights but feels he can proceed with motion today. Attorney Lambert states reasons he wants to amend criminal complaint. Attorney Stichert is objecting as it is prejudicial to his client.
Court grants motion to adjourn. Court will not rule on motion to amend criminal complaint/information at this time until Attorney Stichert can review transcript of preliminary hearing. Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.

from Attorney J. Stichert regarding scheduling
Jury trial - 12 person on December 17, 2014 at 08:15 am.

11:00 Defendant Ray M Poeppel in court with attorney John T. Stichert.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sara McCormick is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. She is an investigator with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. In June of 2014, she interviewed A.M. who indicated approximately in 1999, she was working at a business in the Town of Lincoln, Wood County, and the owner of the business touched her inappropriately. The defendant was the owner of the business. She spoke to the defendant and he denied that it happened. Attorney Stichert cross-examines witness. 
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 09:00 am.
